name: Singel Hotel

reviews.text: We have just returned from a short break in Amsterdam (28th - 30th May 2007) and booked this hotel purely on the strength of the reviews from this site.
reviews.title: A real gem!

reviews.text: Singel Hotel is a "gem" of a hotel - clean, friendly and well situated.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in rooms 23 and 16. Room 16 overlooked the canal and it was a nice size - and very clean. The bathroom had the standard gels and shower caps - there was a bath with overhead shower with plenty of hot water. The beds were extremely comfortable, duvets and nice quality white linen.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great location

reviews.text: I visited Amsterdam with my elderly mother, and she was extremely satisfied with this hotel - the location was very good.
reviews.title: Not great...
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Within a short stroll were lots of different restaurants and taking various short cuts we were in Dam Square within a few minutes.

we stayed at the singel on the 14 april 07, the hotel is lovely and clean,with very helpful and friendly staff , comfy beds with clean sheets and pillows and a clean bathroom with clean towels and shower gel and shampoo provided, breakfast was lovely boiled eggs rolls toast coffee and tea with cream cereal juices fruitbread cheeses hams etc on a buffett so u can get as much as you want , were able to leave our luggage untill we had to leave for the train station which saved us carrying it around all morning, the hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the station,the only negative is that we paid £320 for a 3 night stay and we had to order coffee and tea as there were none in the rooms when the tea and coffee came the cups were very very very small and they were £1.75 per cup i think the tea and coffee should be included in ther room price but apart from that the hotel is perfect i would stay here again
reviews.title: brilliant hotel

likes.liked: — very helpful staff, location, cleanliness,good breakfast
likes.disliked: — no coffee tea in rooms or included in room price

reviews.text: Myself and 3 of my girlfriends are just back from a fantastic trip to Amsterdam..The Singel hotel was more than adequate for our 4 night stay..Ideal location only literally 5 mins walk from Central station and from Dam Square...We stayed in room 33 which had 2 single beds pushed together and one other single bed on the other side of the room..The beds were so comfortable and the bathroom shower was very powerful and water was always hot..Towels were changed daily, the only gripe we had that the window would not stay open but we rectified this ourselves with a book..We had a fab canal view from the room, breakfast was continental buffet style, more than adequate and we found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Will definitely be coming back here..There is a gorgeous tapas bar 2 mins walk from the hotel too.
reviews.title: Ideal location

likes.disliked: — Steps down to the front door, not for disabled or elderly people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed the week before easter. Staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast was the usual buffet style but well presented.
reviews.title: Small Rooms but otherwise very good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location only 5 minutes walk from train station and all the main touristy stuff. However if you like spacious rooms stay elsewhere... we were given a room on the third floor which was clean and functional but very small. Otherwise you'll have a nice stay.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with many small city hotels it depends which room you get as to how well you rate the experience. Having seen another couple of rooms we feel we were lucky to get our room (no 24) as it was bigger, brighter and faced the canal. Having said that it was still small, especially the bathroom which also was unheated. The bathroom also smelled of bad drains when you ran the water. The breakfast room and food served was OK, but they could have done better with a little more effort. The staff were friendly and the hotel location was good, though the red light district has now expanded into this part of town.
reviews.title: Singel is more than adequate

reviews.text: second time was here 7 years ago and the whole package was the same high standard, alright the rooms are on the small size but they are very clean and the bed is comfortable with the best pillows i have ever experienced., and who spends time other than to sleep in. The staff are the best , the breakfast good and hearty and the coffee is to die for. Situation good not be much better and to have a lift in a canal house is very welcome. You will find it hard to find a better place to stay for the price
reviews.title: best value in Amsterdam

reviews.text: This was my 3rd trip to amsterdam and my 2nd stay in the Singel Hotel. I was travelling with a friend and we were there for 4 nights. The room we stayed in was large and very clean and looked like it had just been refurbished. Clean towels were put in the room every day! The television has a lot of channels and you can get BB1 and BB2 with MTV thrown in. I think there were a couple of american channels as well.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Breakfast was from 7 till 10 and consisted of cheese's, breads and jams. Try the fruit loaf toasted with jam and cheese on it!! Yummy!
reviews.title: Small but perfectly formed.

reviews.text: The reception has someone available 24 hours and all the staff are really frondly. If you need anything just let them know and they'll do their best for you. My friend had taken her own towel and it had got mixed up in the hotels ones. We mentioned it to the receptionist and i've just had an e-mail letting me know they'll send it back to the UK for her! Very helpful!
reviews.title: Good hotel in central position.

reviews.text: Planning the next trip now and the Singel is at the top of our list!!
reviews.title: couldn't agree more......
would definitely recommend
reviews.text: We stayed at the Singel Hotel at the end of February 2007 and thought it was great. Really convenient location, clean, comfortable rooms, good breakfast, very helpful and friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked it based on trip advisor reviews which were all very accurate.
reviews.title: Overall, very good

reviews.text: Had a lovely time (despite the constant rain!) and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice central hotel.

likes.liked: — comfortable beds. Nice staff. Central location.

reviews.text: We stayed one night on Valentines Day thsi month and after staying the two previous nights in a hostel, this was lovely. We had room 17 I think, which was at the front of the hotel, over the steps down to reception which was at basement level. This meant we coulnd't leave our windows open at night, or when we went out though, and everyone returning to the hotel waled past out window!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location - definitely recommended

reviews.text: The bathroom was clean and tidy but the plumbing didn't work very well meaning that one shower filled the wet room floor so that the waste water was lapping up to the door into the bedroom - not great when you're wanting to spend ages getting ready to go out for a romantic meal!
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed 2 nights at the Singel. I have never experienced nicer hotel staff. The hotel is an old canal house so the rooms are small but more than adequate. The beds were soft and the down blankets were a luxury. Our room was very quiet because the Singel Hotel is located on a quiet canal just a few blocks from the heart of Amsterdam. It is also a couple of minutes walk from the train station so I had no problems walking from the train. Anne Frank House is close by as is Dam Square. I will return to Amsterdam and stay at the Singel again.
reviews.title: Great place. Will return to this hotel.

likes.liked: — Location was great and hotel has comfy beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: superb,i think recent reviews have covered the good points,& i have no complaints, i can only echo what others have said superb,clean,friendly & an excellent location,i'd certainly go back, my wife & i had a wonderful time,
reviews.title: location,location,location,superb.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Singel Hotel was great. The room was very nice and clean. The furniture was modern and bed comfortable. The staff at the hotel was simply amazing. They were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast, which was included in the price of the hotel, was plentiful (toast, eggs, etc)--we felt no need to have breakfast anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great hotel, amazing staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was really great. It's a 5 minute walk to central station, where every tram and bus in the city stops. Dam Square and Anne Frank's house are also a short walking distance away. The hotel is located on a quiet canal, away from the frenzy of the Red Light District and some of the other areas.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

likes.disliked: — Didn't dislike anything although could have done with tea and coffee stuff in the room

reviews.title: A hidden gem
reviews.text: This is a really nice friendly hotel. Our room was small but clean and perfectly adequate for a city break. The location is great, easy walking distance from the station and also to the central shopping streets and Dam Square. The area is surprisingly quiet considering how central the hotel is.

reviews.title: good, clean, central hotel
reviews.text: We have just recently return from a long weekend at the Singel Hotel. It is a good, clean, unpretentious, reasonably priced central hotel. It is walking distance from the railway station. It is located in a quiet road opposite the canal. It is a great base to explore Amsterdam from. There is a minimum two night stay policy. I paid for the rooms on arrival with my Visa card. I was aware that City Tax was extra - so it was not a shock. Check in 4pm and check out is 12, there is a room to store left luggage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room did not have a canal view unlike my friends (contact the hotel and request a canal view), but we were only in our room for sleeping, etc. The hotel staff were polite and very helpful. Breakfast was also good (cereals, yoghurts, bread, ham, cheese, boiled eggs,etc.), but they could do with more than one toaster.
reviews.title: Loved the Singel!!!

likes.liked: — Comfy Beds! Elevator for lots of bags! Location!!!!
likes.disliked: — dont have fully room service when I am lazy

reviews.text: The bedrooms were not overly spacious, but they were clean. The beds were very comfortable with extra pillows if required. There was a free safe and a TV with same English channels. The bathroom was small but OK - it was basically a wet room (as I have one at home it was not a problem). There was a shower, sink and toilet. There was good water pressure and plenty of hot water (a hairdryer was also provided). It must be remember that the Singel is made up of 3 canal houses - so bathrooms were never going to be big. The rooms were cleaned daily and fresh towels provided. The walls or doors let in some noise, e.g. returning guests at night - but it was not a major problem as I slept well while staying at the Singel. All floors could be accessed using a small lift.
reviews.title: Basic, no frills but satisfactory

likes.disliked: — smoke and noise from other rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Singel Hotel is central to all the sights (e.g. Anna Frank's House is a ten minute walk) and there are Tram stops nearby. There are also plently of pubs, restaurants, coffeeshops/houses nearby. I would be happy to stay at the Singel Hotel again.
reviews.title: Lovely stay in Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — Thin walls - a lady down the corridor was having a lovely night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First...my boyfriend told me to say that I am very picky when it comes to hotels..very picky!!!! I travel ALOT for work and stay in ALOT of hotels...not an excuse, but maybe a reason........as for the SIngel HOtel -->
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Singel for 2 nights for a football trip, the place is easy to find, in a good location, near the station,on the Singel canal, next to a church.
reviews.title: pleasant enough

likes.disliked: — not much view from the rooms on the side of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was comfy and very well heated if a little basic, breakfast was good a variety of cereals, breads, cheese, meats, etc, boiled eggs, juice, tea&coffee
reviews.title: Good location, nice staff and clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a pleasant enough place for a couple of days, mind you we didnt get to bed until 3:30 the first night and well after 4 on the second.
reviews.title: clean,comfortable,central

reviews.text: The guy I roomed with works in pest control and was a stickler about vermin & bed bugs etc before we went and he had no complaints unlike some of our other guys who stayed elsewhere in the city so read into that what you will
reviews.title: Does exactly what it say on the tin...........

reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights. Did ask in advance for a room with canal views but when we arrived was told they were fully booked. Didn't want a room at the back of the hotel due to past reviews.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff, great location

description: Singel Hotel:The Singel Hotel, located in three characteristic 17th century canal houses at the beautiful and quiet Singel canal, is perfectly located in the city centre. This comfortable three star hotel is situated at one of the best locations of Amsterdam. An ideal mix of nostalgic atmosphere and modern comfort close to all major attractions.Typical brown cafes and good restaurants are just around the corner and all public transportation can be reached within walking distance.This charming Singel Hotel offers, behind the attractively restored facade,32 up-to-date renovated rooms, an elevator and accomodation for 65 guests. Our friendly staff will do everything to make your stay unforgetable. Location:The Singel Hotel is very easy to reach. There is a direct train connection from Schiphol Airport to the Amsterdam Central Station which takes less then 15 minutes.Coming out of the Amsterdam Central Station you cross the station square and turnright at the Prins Hendrikkade. After 200 meters you turn left at the Singel canal. You will reach the Singel Hotel in 200 meters.
